symptoms: Expected symptoms include menstrual cramps, fatigue, and mood swings.
advice: During this phase, you may experience bleeding and discomfort. Prioritise self-care and manage discomfort with pain relief.

description: This phase starts after your period ends and lasts until ovulation. You may feel more energetic and experience a rise in libido.
symptoms: Expected symptoms include Increased energy levels, heightened libido and lighter vaginal discharge.
advice: Focus on nutrient-rich foods, engage in moderate-intensity exercises. Prioritise adequate sleep and consider tracking your fertility if trying to conceive.

description: This phase typically occurs around mid-cycle and marks the release of an egg from the ovary. You may experience heightened fertility during this time.
symptoms: Expected symptoms include: an increased libido, changes in cervical mucus consistency and, mild pelvic discomfort.
advice: Consider using protection if not trying to conceive. Monitor ovulation signs like changes in cervical mucus, or abdominal pain. Engage in intimacy if trying to conceive. Stay relaxed and stress-free..

description: This phase occurs after ovulation and lasts until the start of your next period. You may experience PMS symptoms during this time.
advice: Pms or Pmdd symptoms can cause anxiety and concern, practice stress-relief techniques like meditation or yoga. Maintain a balanced diet with calcium rich foods and drink plenty of water. Monitor mood changes and seek support if needed.
